results.content: I am really enjoying this course. This is exactly what I was looking for. I already read lots of concepts about Java Spring Boot, and I wanted to implement a real-life Spring Boot application following all the industrial standards. I love how the instructor doesn't take shortcuts to make life easy for himself, but rather follows most of the Java standard convention and explains it so smoothly. e.g. he uses service pattern and adapter pattern to convert HTTP request body to object.
results.content_html: I am really enjoying this course. This is exactly what I was looking for. I already read lots of concepts about Java Spring Boot, and I wanted to implement a real-life Spring Boot application following all the industrial standards. I love how the instructor doesn't take shortcuts to make life easy for himself, but rather follows most of the Java standard convention and explains it so smoothly. e.g. he uses service pattern and adapter pattern to convert HTTP request body to object.

results.content:
Really great, up to date course for beginner programmers, highly recommended material. Covers many essential topics, which other authors forget to include: JWT token usage for authentication, which is industry standard nowadays, integration tests and microservice architecture. Also event based systems were touched, what other courses don't usually offer.  

One thing that I think can be improved is to introduce Lombok plugin for auto-implementing hashCode, toString and equals methods in later lectures as students get familiar with the necessity to have those methods implemented. It would help to make the code less verbose. Also more information on @Transactional isolation levels can be provided, but that might not suite beginner level tutorials as it's more on the difficult side.

It would help to make the code less verbose. Also more information on @Transactional isolation levels can be provided, but that might not suite beginner level tutorials as it's more on the difficult side.

results.content: If you are looking for a course which demonstrates how to write a loosely coupled group of microservices with real authentication, this is the course for you.  Many of the other courses on spring gloss over or omit the design considerations that this course details so well. Great course!
